Motherfuckers was a “play on words,” alluding to a number of “macho, macho mothers” in political and religious authority. Their first meeting was in early 1962, although they did not begin performing until 1965.
Most of the Motherfuckers’ shows were in New York’s East Village, the most popular being on the Lower East Side at the Café a Go Go, the Electric Circus,and The Performance Gallery, but there were also performances at 112 Workshop on Lafayette Street and on Jones Street.
UAWMF also had a chapter in San Francisco in 1967. The New York chapter disbanded in the early ’70s, although the San Francisco group continued until the early ’90s.
